info:
The line xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"? is an XML declaration. It provides important information about the XML document:
version="1.0": This specifies the version of the XML standard that the document adheres to. In this case, it is XML version 1.0.
encoding="UTF-8": This specifies the character encoding used in the document. UTF-8 is a widely used encoding that can represent any character in the Unicode standard.
The XML declaration is optional but recommended as it helps parsers understand how to correctly read and interpret the document.
